params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a post by the specified ID.
description: The `getPost()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a post whose ID matches the given ID.

examples.title: Get a post by ID
body: *     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

examples.title: Get a post by ID with additional fields @description:
body: *     "contentText": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading. #sea #sun",
*     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

params.name: slug
params.doc:
Slug of the post to retrieve.

The end of a post's URL, for example, `https:/example.com/blog/post/my-post-slug`. Case sensitive and generally based on the post title if not specified.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a post by the provided slug.
description:
The `getPostBySlug()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a post whose slug matches the given slug.

The `slug` is the end of a post's URL that refers to a specific post. For example, if a post's URL is `https:/example.com/blog/post/my-post-slug`, the slug is `my-post-slug`. The slug is case-sensitive, and is generally derived from the post title, unless specified otherwise.

examples.title: Get a post by its slug
body: *     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

examples.title: Get a post by slug with additional fields @description:
body: *     "contentText": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading. #sea #sun",
*     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

description:
The `getPostMetrics()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the specified post's metrics.

A post's metrics include the comments, likes, and views the post receives.

examples.title: Get the metrics of a post

docs.summary: Gets the total amount of published posts on the blog.
description:
The `getTotalPosts()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the total amount of published posts on your blog's site.


You can use the `language` option to filter posts for a specified language.

examples.title: Get the total amount of posts in the blog
Get total number of posts in a specified language

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of published posts.
description:
The `listPosts()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 published posts.

Using the `options` parameter, you can filter your list of posts, set the amount of posts to be returned, and sort your list in a specified order.

By default, the list is sorted by `firstPublishedDate` in descending order, and the amount of posts returned is 50.

examples.title: List posts from a blog
body: *       "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

examples.title: List posts from a blog with filter, sorting and paging options
body: *       "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*       "excerpt": "Let's talk about choosing best peppers for amazing peppercorn sauce",

extra.description: This example uses the options parameter to filter, sort, and page the posts from a blog.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying time frame, sort, and filter.

docs.summary: Retrieves the number of published posts per month within a specified time range.
description:
The `queryPostCountStats()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the number of posts per month within the specified time range.

You can set the time range using the `rangeStart` and `months` properties. The time range always starts on the 1st of the month set in `rangeStart`. It includes the number of `months` following `rangeStart`. For example, if `rangeStart` is set to `'2022-03-13'` and `months` is set to `4`, the time range will be from `'2022-03-01'` until `'2022-06-30'`. Notice that the time range ends on the last of the month.

>**Note:** If there are no published posts in a specific month, that month is not included in the response. For example, let's say a blog has `0` posts dated in February 2022. `months` and `rangeStart` are set to `3` and `'2022-01-01'` respectively. Your result will only include the `postCount` from January and March.

extra.description: This example uses `queryPostCountStats()` to retrieve the `postCount` of published posts per month.

examples.title: Get post count per month within a given time period

extra.description: This example uses `queryPostCountStats()` to retrieve the `postCount` of published posts per month within a given time frame.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of posts.
description: The `queryPosts()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of up to 100 posts, and returns a [`PostsQueryBuilder`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/post/postsquerybuilder) object.

The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/post/postsquerybuilder/find) function.
You can refine the query by chaining `PostsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `PostsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryPosts()` returns.
`queryPosts()` runs with these `PostsQueryBuilder` defaults that can be overridden:
Note that the default limit is `'50'`, but the max limit is `'100'`.
To learn how to query posts, refer to the table below.

The following `PostsQueryBuilder` functions are supported for the `queryPosts()` function. For a full description of the Posts object, see the object returned for the `items` property in `PostsQueryResult`.

examples.title: Retrieve a list of all posts
body: *     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*     "title": "Transform your winter blues into winter creativity",
*     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

extra.description: This example uses the `queryPosts()` function to retrieve a list of all posts.

examples.title: Query for posts with filters
body: *     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*     "title": "Transform your winter blues into winter creativity",
*     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

extra.description: This example uses the `queryPosts()` function to search for posts that have at least 1 of 2 specified hashtags, and less than 1 view.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the image's download button is disabled.

members.name: disableExpand
members.doc: Sets whether the image expands to full screen when clicked.

members.name: image
members.doc: Image file details.

members.name: link
members.doc: Link details for images that are links.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of posts copied.

members.name: altText
members.doc: Item's alternative text.

members.name: image
members.doc: An image item.

members.name: title
members.doc: Item title.

members.name: video
members.doc: A video item.

members.name: image
members.doc: An image item.

members.name: video
members.doc: A video item.

members.name: crop
members.doc: Sets how item images are cropped.

members.name: ratio
members.doc: Item ratio

members.name: spacing
members.doc: The spacing between items in pixels.

members.name: targetSize
members.doc: Desirable dimension for each item in pixels (behvaior changes according to gallery type)

members.name: horizontalScroll
members.doc: Sets whether horizontal scroll is enabled.

members.name: mobileNumberOfColumns
members.doc: The number of columns to display on mobile screens.

members.name: numberOfColumns
members.doc: The number of columns to display on full size screens.

members.name: orientation
members.doc: Gallery orientation.

members.name: type
members.doc: Gallery layout type.

members.name: anchor
members.doc: The target node's ID. Used for linking to another node in this object.

members.name: customData
members.doc: A serialized object used for a custom or external link panel.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

members.name: target
members.doc:
he HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the linked document.

members.name: link
members.doc: Link details.

members.name: anchor
members.doc: The target node's ID. Used for linking to another node in this object.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the linked document.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the link preview's container.

members.name: description
members.doc: Preview description.

members.name: html
members.doc: The preview content as HTML.

members.name: link
members.doc: Link details.

members.name: thumbnailUrl
members.doc: Preview thumbnail URL.

members.name: title
members.doc: Preview title.

members.name: categoryIds
members.doc:
Category filter.

Pass an array of category IDs to return posts with any of the provided categories.
If omitted, all posts with or without category IDs are returned.

members.name: featured
members.doc: Whether to return only featured posts.

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: __Deprecated.__ Use ListPostsRequest.fieldsets

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of post fields to be included in the response. By default, any fields not passed are not returned.

Supported Values:
`"CONTACT_ID"`, `"CONTENT_TEXT"`, `"METRICS"`, `"SEO"`, and `"URL"`.

members.name: hashtags
members.doc:
Hashtag filter.

Pass an array of hashtags to return posts with any of the provided hashtags (anywhere in the post content).
If omitted, all posts with or without hashtags are returned.

members.name: language
members.doc:
Language filter.

2-letter language code in [ISO 639-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) format.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Post owner's member ID.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort order by descending view count, ascending or descending publish date, or default to descending by publish date with pinned posts first.

members.name: tagIds
members.doc:
Tag filter.

Pass an array of tag IDs to return posts with any of the provided tags.
If omitted, all posts with or without tag IDs are returned.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: New blog version instance id

members.name: paging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results

members.name: pagingMetaData
members.doc: Pagination

members.name: posts
members.doc: List of posts

members.name: postsMigrationMeta
members.doc: Data of post in old blog by post id

members.name: categoryIds
members.doc:
List of category IDs to filter for.

Default: All categories

members.name: featured
members.doc: Featured filter. Whether to return only featured posts.

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: __Deprecated.__ Use ListPostsOptions.fieldsets

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of post fields to be included in the response. By default, any fields not passed are not returned.

Supported Values:
`"CONTACT_ID"`, `"CONTENT_TEXT"`, `"METRICS"`, `"SEO"`, and `"URL"`.

members.name: hashtags
members.doc:
List of hashtags to filter for.

Default: All hashtags

members.name: language
members.doc:
Language filter.

2-letter language code in [ISO 639-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) format.

members.name: memberId
members.doc:
Member ID to filter for.

Default: All members

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort order.

Sort by one of the following:
 - `'VIEW_COUNT'` descending view count
 - `'LIKE_COUNT'` descending like count
 - `'PUBLISHED_DATE_ASC'` ascending published date
 - `'PUBLISHED_DATE_DESC'` (default) descending published date
 - `'TITLE_ASC'` ascending title
 - `'TITLE_DESC'` descending title

members.name: tagIds
members.doc:
List of tag IDs to filter for.

Default: All tags

members.doc:
Category filter.

Pass an array of category IDs to return posts with any of the provided categories.
If omitted, all posts with or without category IDs are returned.

Supported Values:
`"CONTACT_ID"`, `"CONTENT_TEXT"`, `"METRICS"`, `"SEO"`, and `"URL"`.

description: `ListValue` is a wrapper around a repeated field of values.

members.doc: Sets whether the map is draggable.

members.doc: Initial zoom value.

members.name: lng

members.doc: Location name.

members.name: mapType
members.doc: Map type. `HYBRID` is a combination of the `ROADMAP` and `SATELLITE` map types.

members.name: viewModeControl

members.doc: Sets whether zoom control is enabled.

members.name: duration
members.doc: Media duration in seconds. Only relevant for audio and video files.

members.name: width

members.name: total

Status indicating whether the submission was approved or rejected by the moderator.

members.name: submittedBy

members.name: paddingBottom
members.doc: The bottom padding value in pixels.

members.name: paddingTop
members.doc: The top padding value in pixels.

members.name: authorName
members.doc: The name of the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: authorUrl
members.doc: The URL for the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: html
members.doc: HTML for embedding a video player. The HTML should have no padding or margins.

members.name: providerName
members.doc: The name of the resource provider.

members.name: providerUrl
members.doc: The URL for the resource provider.

members.name: thumbnailHeight
members.doc: The height of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailWidth`must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailUrl
members.doc: The URL for a thumbnail image for the resource. If this property is defined, `thumbnailWidth` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailWidth
members.doc: The width of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: title
members.doc: Resource title.

members.name: type
members.doc: The resource type.

members.name: url
members.doc: The source URL for the resource.

members.name: version
members.doc: The oEmbed version number.  This value must be `1.0`.

members.name: videoUrl
members.doc: The URL for an embedded viedo.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: newBlogInstanceId
members.doc: Instance id of new version of blog

members.name: oldBlogInstanceId
members.doc: Instance id of old version of blog

members.name: _id
members.doc: Option ID.

members.name: image
members.doc: The image displayed with the option.

members.name: title
members.doc: Option title.

members.name: borderRadius
members.doc: Border radius in pixels.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display option images.

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF download button is disabled.

members.name: disablePrint
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF print button is disabled.

members.name: viewMode
members.doc:
PDF view mode. One of the following:
`NONE` : The PDF isn't displayed.
`FULL` : A full page view of the PDF is displayed.
`MINI` : A mini view of the PDF is displayed.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level from 1-6.

members.name: textStyle
members.doc: Styling for the paragraph text.

members.name: periodStart
members.doc: Start of time range in ISO 8601 date and time format.

members.name: postCount
members.doc: Number of posts published during this month.

description: Post count for a specific time period

members.name: periodStart
members.doc: Start of time range in ISO 8601 date and time format.

members.name: publicationsCount
members.doc: Number of posts published during this month.

description: Publications count for a specific time period

members.name: allowMultipleVotes
members.doc: Sets whether one voter can vote multiple times.

members.name: view
members.doc: Sets who can view the poll results.

members.name: vote
members.doc: Sets who can vote.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: autoPlay
members.doc: Sets whether the media will automatically start playing.

members.name: playInLoop
members.doc: Sets whether media's will be looped.

members.name: showControls
members.doc: Sets whether media's controls will be shown.

members.name: alignment
members.doc: The node's alignment within its container.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: spoiler
members.doc: Spoiler cover settings for the node.

members.name: textWrap
members.doc: Sets whether text should wrap around this node when it's displayed. If `textWrap` is `false`, the node takes up the width of its container.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: Small width.
`ORIGINAL`: The width of the container matches the original asset width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: Full width.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: Small width.
`ORIGINAL`: The width of the container matches the original asset width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: Full width.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Poll ID.

members.name: creatorId
members.doc: Poll creator ID.

members.name: image
members.doc: Main poll image.

members.name: options
members.doc: Voting options.

members.name: settings
members.doc: The poll's permissions and display settings.

members.name: title
members.doc: Poll title.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the poll's container.

members.name: design
members.doc: Styling for the poll and voting options.

members.name: layout
members.doc: Layout settings for the poll and voting options.

members.name: poll
members.doc: Poll data.

members.name: options
members.doc: Voting otpions layout settings.

members.name: poll
members.doc: Poll layout settings.

members.name: background
members.doc: Background styling.

members.name: borderRadius
members.doc: Border radius in pixels.

members.name: direction
members.doc: The direction of the text displayed in the voting options. Text can be displayed either right-to-left or left-to-right.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display the main poll image.

members.name: type
members.doc: The layout for displaying the voting options.

members.name: permissions
members.doc: Permissions settings for voting.

members.name: showVoters
members.doc: Sets whether voters are displayed in the vote results.

members.name: showVotesCount
members.doc: Sets whether the vote count is displayed.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Post ID.

members.name: categoryIds
members.doc: [Category IDs](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/category) of the post.

members.name: commentingEnabled
members.doc: Whether commenting on the post is enabled.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Post owner's [contact ID](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-crm-backend/contacts).

members.name: content
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: contentId
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: contentText
members.doc: The post's content in plain text.

members.name: coverMedia
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: excerpt
members.doc:
Post excerpt.
Can be selected by a site contributor. By default, it is extracted from the content text's first characters.

Max: 140 characters

members.name: featured
members.doc: Whether the post is marked as featured.

members.name: firstPublishedDate
members.doc: Date the post was first published.

members.name: hashtags
members.doc: Hashtags that are scraped from post content.

members.name: heroImage
members.doc: Image placed at the top of the blog page. Only displays on mobile devices.

members.name: internalCategoryIds
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: internalId
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: internalRelatedPostIds
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: language
members.doc:
Language the post is written in.

2-letter language code in [ISO 639-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) format.

members.name: lastPublishedDate
members.doc: Date the post was last published.

members.name: media
members.doc: Post cover media.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Post owner's [member ID](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend).

members.name: minutesToRead
members.doc: Estimated reading time.

members.name: moderationDetails
members.doc:
Post moderation details.

Only relevant to posts submitted by [guest writers](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-blog-moderating-blog-posts-from-your-guest-writers). Guest writers have the ability to write posts but not publish them. These posts can be rejected or approved for publishing by a blog editor or site owner.

members.name: mostRecentContributorId
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: pinned
members.doc: Whether the post is pinned. If `true`, post is placed at the top of the post list.

members.name: pricingPlanIds
members.doc:
Pricing plan IDs.

If a post is assigned to a specific pricing plan.

members.name: relatedPostIds
members.doc: IDs of posts related to the post.

members.name: richContent
members.doc: Post rich content

members.name: seoData
members.doc: SEO data.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
Part of a post's URL that refers to a specific post.

For example, `'https:/example.com/posts/my-post-slug'`.

members.name: tagIds
members.doc: IDs of [tags](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/tags) the post is tagged with.

members.name: title
members.doc: Post title.

members.name: translationId
members.doc: ID of the post's translations when [Wix Multilingual](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-multilingual-translating-your-blog) is installed on a site. All translations of a single post will share the same `translationId`.

members.name: url
members.doc: Post URL.

members.name: comments
members.doc: Total number of post comments

members.name: likes
members.doc: Total number of post likes

members.name: views
members.doc: Total number of post views

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID if person that liked the post is not logged in

members.name: counter
members.doc: New counter value.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID of person who triggered the counter update

members.name: postId
members.doc: ID of the post which counters were updated.

members.name: updatedCounterField
members.doc: Field of the updated counter.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID if person that liked the post is not logged in

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID of person who triggered the counter update

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID if person that liked the post is not logged in

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID of person who liked a post (returned if the member was logged in when liking the post)

members.name: postId
members.doc: ID of the liked post.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID if person that liked the post is not logged in

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID of person who liked a post (returned if the member was logged in when liking the post)

members.name: language
members.doc:
Language filter.

2-letter language code in [ISO 639-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) format.

members.name: months
members.doc: Number of months to include in response.

members.name: order
members.doc:
Sort order.
Use `'ASC'` for ascending order or `'DESC'` for descending order.

Default: `ASC`

members.name: rangeEnd
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: rangeStart
members.doc: Start of time range to return, in ISO 8601 date and time format.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
Time zone to use when calculating the start of the month.

[UTC timezone offset](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UTC_offsets) format. For example, New York time zone is `-05`.

description: Get Blog Post Count Stats request

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: __Deprecated.__ Use QueryPostsRequest.fieldsets

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of post fields to be included in the response. By default, any fields not passed are not returned.

Supported Values:
`"CONTACT_ID"`, `"CONTENT_TEXT"`, `"METRICS"`, `"SEO"`, and `"URL"`.

description: Get Blog Publications Count Stats response

members.name: liked
members.doc: Is post liked by the current user

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protect referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the page’s author. For example, a link in a fourm post.

members.name: documentStyle
members.doc: Global styling for header, paragraph, block quote, and code block nodes in the object.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Object metadata.

members.name: nodes
members.doc: Node objects representing a rich content document.

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tags information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc: disable auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes (enabled by default).

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: buttonText
members.doc: The text for the button used to remove the spoiler cover.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description displayed on top of the spoiler cover.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Sets whether the spoiler cover is enabled for this node.

members.name: border
members.doc: Border attributes.

members.name: colors
members.doc: Color attributes.

members.name: borderColors
members.doc: The cell's border colors.

members.name: cellStyle
members.doc: Styling for the cell's background color and text alignment.

members.name: columnHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first column is a header.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the table's container.

members.name: dimensions
members.doc: The table's dimensions.

members.name: header
members.doc: Deprecated: Use `rowHeader` and `columnHeader` instead.

members.name: rowHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first row is a header.

members.name: children
members.doc: Tag inner content e.g. `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: Tag meta data, e.g. {height: 300, width: 240}.

members.name: props
members.doc: SEO tag attributes/properties (name, content, rel, href).

members.name: type
members.doc: SEO tag type. Supported values: `title`, `meta`, `script`, `link`.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply.

members.name: text
members.doc: The text to apply decorations to.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply to the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: Line height for text in the node.

members.name: nodeStyle
members.doc: Padding and background color for the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text as a unitless ratio.

members.name: textAlignment
members.doc: Text alignment. Defaults to `AUTO`.

members.name: placement
members.doc: Thumbnail alignment.

members.name: spacing
members.doc: Spacing between thumbnails in pixels.

members.name: media
members.doc: Video file details.

members.name: thumbnail
members.doc: Video thumbnail file details.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the video's container.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the video's download button is disabled.

members.name: options
members.doc: Video options.

members.name: thumbnail
members.doc: Video thumbnail details.

members.name: title
members.doc: Video title.

members.name: video
members.doc: Video details.

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.

members.name: height
members.doc: Video height.

members.name: url
members.doc: Video URL.

members.name: width
members.doc: Video width.

members.name: image
members.doc: Thumbnail or image details.

members.name: videoV2
members.doc: Video details. Optional
